column5: Going to Canada at the end of the week. We are taking 3 boats, one of which is a proven gas hog. Aside from what is in the truck and boat, how much more gas per person can you bring? I have heard both 5 gals and 10 gallons per person. Just want to keep it legal.ThanksSportfisher

It's not "illegal" to take as much gas as you need, but you might have to pay a duty. I've taken 50 gallons before and customs didn't blink an eye, sometimes they ask, sometimes they dont. Thinking back over the past thirty years I don't think I've ever had to pay a duty on gas, maybe I'm just lucky.

There was just another post on this topic. The verdict was you can take as much gas as you will need for your stay. Some lodges ask that their guests not have gas cans stored around their cabins due to insurance issues.
Don't forget the extra can to hide the leeches in.
